meanings.sent1: The picnic basket will comprize sandwiches, fruits, and drinks.
meanings.sent2: The gift basket will comprize chocolates, cookies, and a teddy bear.
meanings.sent3: I hope the surprise box will comprize a puppy!
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to comprize an endless well of love.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest will comprize jewels beyond imagination.

meanings.definition: To consist of or be made up of
meanings.sent1: The colorful painting will comprize various shades of blue and green.
meanings.sent2: The delicious cake will comprize layers of chocolate and cream.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious potion will comprize ingredients from ancient spells.
meanings.sent4: His personality seemed to comprize contradictions that intrigued everyone.
meanings.sent5: The magical forest will comprize trees that whisper ancient secrets.

meanings.definition: To summarize or give a brief overview
meanings.sent1: The report will comprize the key findings of the study.
meanings.sent2: The presentation will comprize the main points of the project.
meanings.sent3: The recipe card will comprize the steps to bake a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: His speech seemed to comprize the essence of wisdom distilled over years.
meanings.sent5: The map will comprize all the important landmarks in the city.
